channel.title: Mcain vs Obama
channel.description:
British or Austrailan people can ignore if they want to.
I personally like Obama, what about you guys?

item.title: Mcain vs Obama
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

[quote=“JukuG, post:135, topic:229655”][quote author=Tamorak` link=topic=302176.msg2425021#msg2425021 date=1220561291]
Obama. I don’t approve of Mccain and his views on certain things he seems like another George Bush to me.
[/quote]

My words exactly.[/quote]

According to his words when he was being interviewed (interrogated) on CNN he said he voted with President bush 90% of the time. I did research on my own and he did not disagree with bush on the Economic and Foreign Policies which of course are not working, then him being a hypocrite denies it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @hasumon hasumon
item.description:
@hasumon wrote:

If McCain won, there would a big war against whites with blacks ending with a nuke on all of us.
If Obama won, there would be an assassination on him and then a big war with the nuke.

item.title: Mcain vs Obama
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“army_life, post:132, topic:229655”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=302176.msg2479346#msg2479346 date=1223431172]

In four-eight years he wont all this country’s mess will take decades to ‘fully’ fix and return it to what is was in the 40’s.

The U.S. was still recovering from the Great Depression in the 1940’s. Ironically, it was a war economy that offset the Depression itself. Get you facts right.
[/quote]

It was actually caused by several reasons such as central bank policies, and political decision making. And excuse me it was the 30’s and no the US already recovered from the great depression I will PROVE YOU WRONG later tomorrow.[/quote]
War increased demand for copper and other ores and metals, raising prices and making money, giving more workers paychecks, which means more buyers to other stores, and there workers by more etc etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Mcain vs Obama
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:124, topic:229655”][quote author=cooper link=topic=302176.msg2465865#msg2465865 date=1222718092]

Obama will likely be assassinated if he is elected. Just the way it is. Most people will not support a black president and therefore he will be killed. End of story. I am not intending to be racist, however that’s how this will probably unfold.

Perhaps even before he is elected [if this happens, does McCain autowin?]. Hopefully it can be avoided, though.
[/quote]

McCain wouldn’t be elected if Obama was assinated, that’s why V.P.'s like Biden are here. They’re basically just back-ups in case the actual president is unable to lead.[/quote]
Wow I forgot about Biden when I typed that…

Read full topic

McCain wouldn’t be elected if Obama was assinated, that’s why V.P.'s like Biden are here. They’re basically just back-ups in case the actual president is unable to lead.[/quote]
But what happens if Both Obama and his V.P or McCain and his V.P dies on the same time?

item.title: Mcain vs Obama
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:118, topic:229655”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=302176.msg2463534#msg2463534 date=1222604439]
America isn’t even democratic. You can only choose between 2 party’s, and I doubt that you can start your own. I once again say that the country itself is great, but the inhabitants are mainly stupid. It’s better to make the states individual country’s and let them work together as in Europe.
[/quote]
Europe start to make a USE now, with more and more controll to EU.
But you have rigth, it should be more than 2 parties to vote on, but there is more than 2 parties in US, why can’t they be in the election?[/quote]They can’t be in the election because they don’t have enough funding to make an election campaign. As you can see, only the rich people can become presidents.

Read full topic
